abstract: Cisco’s shareholders have watched the value of their stock decline by roughly a third over the last decade.
snippet: Cisco’s shareholders have watched the value of their stock decline by roughly a third over the last decade.
lead_paragraph: John T. Chambers, chief executive of the networking giant Cisco Systems, is keeping the acquisition machine humming. The company’s $2.9 billion deal for Starent Networks is the second of roughly that size in October alone. And he has promised that more deals are coming. It’s too bad this strategy hasn’t quite paid off for shareholders recently.

byline.original: By Robert Cyran and Lauren Silva Laughlin

abstract: Cisco Systems acquisition strategy hasn’t quite paid off for shareholders recently, Breakingviews says.
